name: scalasca
description:
Scalasca is a software tool that supports the performance optimization
of parallel programs by measuring and analyzing their runtime behavior.
The analysis identifies potential performance bottlenecks - in
particular those concerning communication and synchronization - and
offers guidance in exploring their causes.

dependencies.name: gnuconfig
dependencies.description:
The GNU config.guess and config.sub scripts versioned by timestamp.
This package can be used as a build dependency for autotools packages
that ship a tarball with outdated config.guess and config.sub files.

dependencies.name: mpi
dependencies.description:
MPItrampoline: A forwarding MPI implementation that can use any other
MPI implementation via an MPI ABI.

dependencies.name: cubew
dependencies.description: Component of CubeBundle: High performance C Writer library

dependencies.name: scorep
dependencies.description:
The Score-P measurement infrastructure is a highly scalable and easy-to-
use tool suite for profiling, event tracing, and online analysis of HPC
applications.

dependencies.name: otf2
dependencies.description:
The Open Trace Format 2 is a highly scalable, memory efficient event
trace data format plus support library.

dependencies.name: cube
dependencies.description:
Cube the profile viewer for Score-P and Scalasca profiles. It displays a
multi-dimensional performance space consisting of the dimensions: -
performance metric - call path - system resource
